title: Early Childhood Attachment Parenting
headline: This free online course teaches how early attachment parenting can benefit and promote better child development.
description: Becoming a parent can be daunting, particularly with numerous beliefs on how you should bring up a child. This course discusses how different attachment types affect children. You will discover the history of attachment theory and explore how attachment-based parenting and skin-to-skin contact supports infant brain development. Following that, we will learn how healthcare professionals and fathers can encourage and promote breastfeeding.
courseDescription:
In this course, ‘Early Childhood Attachment Parenting’, we discuss the basics of attachment-based parenting and the history of attachment theory. Next, we will look at the importance of the umbilical cord. Are you wondering how to deal with your child's birth trauma after birth? We will explore the importance of skin-to-skin contact between newborns and mothers, how it can support the development of the baby's brain and the benefits of sharing a room with your infant. We will also examine the father's role in the birth process.

The course will then focus on the benefits of breastfeeding and discuss in detail the maternal, infant and environmental factors involved. Next, we will explore the role of healthcare professionals in promoting breastfeeding. We will also discuss the father's role in breastfeeding and how he can support breastfeeding. Next, we will look at the importance of attachment-based parenting for breastfeeding and the disadvantages of bottle feeding. We demonstrate how attachment parenting deals with an infant's crying and excessive crying behaviour.

We will then discuss the concept of co-sleeping from the perspective of attachment parenting. Research how it can help reduce nighttime anxiety between mother and child. We then delve into the issues that working mothers face in attachment parenting. We will explore how to overcome these challenges for working mothers. In addition, we discuss some essential benefits of attachment-based parenting. If you are interested in learning more about this technique or child development, this course is for you. So why wait?
